introduction:

vocabulary.definition: a general vote by the electorate on a single political question that has been referred to them for a direct decision.
vocabulary.example: The referendum on the new law will take place next month.

vocabulary.definition: causing disagreement or discussion due to opposing views.
vocabulary.example: The decision to cut down the old trees in the park was controversial among the residents.

vocabulary.definition: measures taken to protect or ensure the safety of something or someone.
vocabulary.example: The new security system includes several safeguards to prevent unauthorized access.

vocabulary.definition: to put a decision, plan, agreement, etc. into effect.
vocabulary.example: The company will implement new policies to improve employee satisfaction.

vocabulary.definition: a constitutional right to reject a decision or proposal made by a law-making body.
vocabulary.example: The President has the power to veto any bill passed by Congress.
The distribution of resources in the country was uneven, leading to disparities in development.
